data.name: lblRecentRssEntriesMax.Help
data.value: You can limit the number of RSS entries for Most recent entries.

data.name: lblRecentEntriesMax.Help
data.value: The maximum number of blog entries that will be displayed in any given view of the module at a single time. The initial view of the module does not show paging and will only permit this number of items to be displayed.

data.name: lblSummary.Help
data.value: Enter the desired cutoff in characters for the auto-generated summary of blog entries. To set no limit, enter a value of 0. Use the avanced option labeled Enforce Summary Truncation to also truncate entries with summaries. The default is to only truncate auto-generated summaries.

data.name: lblUploadOption.Help
data.value: If you enable this option you give users the permission to upload images and attachments to their blog entry.

data.name: lblMandatory.Help
data.value: When entering a blog entry, this setting forces the user to enter a summary of their blog entry.

data.name: lblShowSummary.Help
data.value: If this option is enabled, the summary (if available) will be shown on the top of the single entry view.

data.name: ModuleHelp.Text
data.value:
Blog - Module Options

These settings apply to all the blogs displayed in the page.

Make Entry Summary Mandatory
If checked, users will need to add a brief summary to their blog entries before publishing.

Limit Auto-Generated Entry Summary To
If a summary is not provided for the entry, the Blog module will attempt to generate one based on the entry content. This setting limits the maximum number of charachters that are used. If a summary is present, this setting will not apply unless the Enforce Entry Summary Limit is turned on. If 0 is used, and the entry summary is empty, then all the entry content is displayed.

Limit Search Summary To
This is the maximum number of charachters that are being used to display in the search results. Using a high limit may result in performance loss.

Limit Upload Image Width ToThis is the maximum width of the images that will be uploaded by users.

Limit recent entries to
This setting limits the number of recent entries that are displayed in the main view when first visiting the page.

Limit Recent RSS entries to
This setting limits the number of recent entries that are displayed in the RSS feed.

Show Avatars
If checked, personal avatars will be available in comments.

Image Width
This setting controls the fixed image width used to display avatars. The default width (48) matches the default style of the comments.

Image Rating
This setting helps controlling the image content that can be used in avatars. Gravatar images are rated based on the content. G rated images are appropriate for all audiences while PG, R and X rated images may contain inappropriate for some audiences.

Default Image URL
If an email address is not provided by the user leaving the comment, a default image is used instead. Here is where you define it. These images will be used for comments left by users without a Gravatar. About Identicon, Wavicon, and MonsterID: Gravatar will be displayed for users who have one, otherwise, a unique identifying image will be created for them based on the IP address of their computer, or on their email address if provided. About custom images: provide the complete URL to the image (including "http://").

Custom Image URL
If Custom is used as Default Image URL, here is where needs to be entered the image URL (including "http://").

Show Website
If checked, readers will be able to include their website when leaving comments. This will show as a hyperlink in their name.

Show Title
Check to allow users to create unique titles for entry comments.

Allow Hyperlinks in Comments
Check to allow hyperlinks to be entered in comments.

Allow Images in Comments
Check to allow images to be included in comments.

Allow Basic Formatting in Comments
Check to allow basic formatting in comments (b or strong, i or em, u and blockquote).

Show unique title
If you enable this option a blog specific title will be displayed in the title bar of the browser.

Show SEO Friendly URLs
If you enable this option, then the URL will be modified to replace default.aspx with the title of the blog entry as follows: .../Blog-Entry-Title.aspx. This URL format can help with search engine optimization. The default is set to true.

Regenerate all Permalinks for this Modue
Regenerate the permalink saved for the entries shown in this module. This is useful mainly for regenerating the permalinks after a change has been made to the URL format for a site.

Allow Upload Options
If you enable this option you give users the permission to upload images and attachments to their blog entry.

Personal Blog Page
Select the blog which should be used on this tab. For a general Blog page please don't select a specific Blog.

Enable DNN Search
If you enabled this option the content of that module will be indexed by the DNN search, please take care of that you only enbable this option for one module (your main blog page), if you enable this option for more then one module you will get duplicated search results.

Enable Social Bookmarks
If you enable this option, a social bookmarks toolbar will be added to your blog entry page.

Enforce Entry Summary Limit
Checking this option will cause both auto-generated and actual entry summaries to be truncated based on the value entered in the 'Limit Entry Summary To' setting above.

Incluse Summary in Entry
If this option is enabled, the summary (if available) will be shown on the top of the single entry view.

data.name: cmdGenerateLinks.Text
data.value: Regenerate all Permalinks for this Module

data.name: lblPageBlogs.Help
data.value: Select the blog which should be used on this tab. For a general Blog page please don't select a specific Blog

data.name: lblShowUniqueTitle.Help
data.value: If you enable this option a blog specific title will be displayed in the title bar of the browser

data.name: lblMaxImageWidth.Help
data.value: You can limit the image width to a maximum with this option

data.name: lblShowSeoFriendlyUrl.Help
data.value: If you enable this option, then the URL will be modified to replace default.aspx with the title of the blog entry as follows: .../Blog-Entry-Title.aspx. This URL format can help with search engine optimization. The default is set to true.

data.name: lblShowWebsite.Help
data.value: Check to allow website to be included with comment.

data.name: lblShowTitle.Help
data.value: Check to allow users to create unique titles for entry comments

data.name: lblRegenerateLinks.Help
data.value: Regenerate the permalink saved for the entries shown in this module. This is useful mainly for regenerating the permalinks after a change has been made to the URL format for a site.

data.name: lblEnforceSummaryTruncation.Help
data.value: Checking this option will cause both auto-generated and actual entry summaries to be truncated based on the value entered in the 'Limit Entry Summary To' setting above.

data.name: lblIncludeBody.Help
data.value: Include body of post if requested through body=true

data.name: lblIncludeCategoriesInDescription.Help
data.value: Include a text underneath the summary of the post with the categories

data.name: lblIncludeTagsInDescription.Help
data.value: Include a text underneath the summary of the post with the tags

data.name: lblAllowSummaryHtml.Help
data.value: If checked allows user to enter post summary with markup

data.name: lblAllowChildBlogs.Help
data.value: Users can create child blogs. Child blogs are superceded by categories from version 4 onward.

data.name: lblChildBlogsStatus.Text
data.value: There are {0} child blogs defined in this portal.

data.name: lblMigrateChildblogs.Help
data.value: Child blogs are succeeded by categories as of version 4 of this module. You can migrate existing child blogs to categories here. Note you can keep working with child blogs as before if you wish.

data.name: MigrateConfirm.Text
data.value: Are you sure you wish to eliminate all child blogs and move their content to categories instead?

data.name: lblAllowWLW.Help
data.value: If checked users will be able to use Windows Live Writer (or other remote blogging tools that use the MetaWeblog API) to post and edit blog posts.

data.name: lblEnableArchiveDropDown.Help
data.value: If checked, the list of archived months will be displayed as a drop down list instead of a data list (default).

data.name: lblEnableArchiveDropDown.Text
data.value: Use Drop Down List For Archive

data.name: lblAllowMultipleCategories.Help
data.value: If selected users can select multiple categories per post

data.name: lblUseWLWExcerpt.Help
data.value: If selected then in WLW the user can use the Excerpt textbox at the bottom to create a summary of the post in plain text. Any split in the post will be ignored and the excerpt will be used instead. This is useful if you want to ensure the summaries are text only (i.e. not HTML).

data.name: lblUseWLWExcerpt.Text
data.value: Use Excerpt in Windows Live Writer

data.name: lblHostFiles.Help
data.value: Files that were distributed as part of the Blog module

data.name: lblPortalFiles.Help
data.value: Files specific to your portal (under [portal home directory]/Blog/Include)

data.name: lblCatVocabRoot.Help
data.value: A portal level vocabulary root must be specified in order for categories to be available to bloggers for selection.

data.name: lblAddThisId.Help
data.value: This is required when using AddThis social sharing to enable analytics.

data.name: lblEnableLinkedIN.Help
data.value: If checked, the Linked In share button will be displayed in the blog entry view.

data.name: lblEnablePlusOne.Help
data.value: If checked, the +1 share button will be displayed in the Question view.

data.name: lblEnableTwitter.Help
data.value: If checked, the Twitter share button will be displayed in the Question view.

data.name: lblFacebookAppId.Help
data.value: To enable Facebook likes, you must enter a Facebook application ID (which can be retrieved while logged into Facebook).

data.name: lblSocialSharingMode.Help
data.value: Select from one of the available options to see which Social Sharing services you can utilize across all blogs.

data.name: lblCommentMode.Help
data.value: Choose one of three modes for commenting.
